info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 23 at 3:25AM CDT until March 24 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS La Crosse WI
info.description:
...SNOW, WINTRY MIX TODAY FOR CENTRAL WISCONSIN...
.A wintry mix of precipitation will transition to rain and snow and then just snow by late morning, persisting through the afternoon. There will be a sharp cutoff to snow amounts on the western side of the storm with totals quickly dropping off as one travels west. A few inches of wet snow accumulations are currently expected west of highway 73 in Wisconsin.
Northwest winds will pick up this evening, but widespread blowing and drifting snows are not expected. However, any snow laden tree branches coupled with the wind could be more apt to snap.
* WHAT...Snow to a wintry mix. Snow accumulations or 1 to 3 inches, highest in eastern parts of Clark County. A glaze of ice possible this morning. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph.
* WHERE...Clark County.
* WHEN...Until 1 AM CDT Monday.
* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511wi.gov for road conditions.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM CDT MONDAY
